CatDescriptText: Agnes Capp, salad girl, Lawrenceville was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 20, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe in the old-fashioned "woodshed" reprimand or the "talking things over with the offender" type of discipline as regards the correction of youngsters guilty of misdemeanors?" Answer reads: "Talking is better. If it is reasonable, it is better than a paddle."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Agnes Capp wearing light colored head scarf, eyeglasses, dark gloves, and tweed coat, standing in front of Sylvia and Jean's Beauty Shoppe, Smithfield Street, Downtown
